content: the perlina beaded bracelet design by amy drossner copyright © june 2022 the perlina is a beautiful unique design that incorporates beads into your crocheted piece it is a bracelet in this pattern but you can make a piece that is as long or short as you like this pattern is easily adaptable to a variety of items and can be easily modified with different yarn weights hooks and types of beads i give some ideas and suggestions in the notes at the beginning and at the end of the pattern the perlina is a uniquely different type of crochet pattern it is very important that you read through all of the notes before choosing your yarn beads and fasteners important please read all notes before choosing your yarn beads and fasteners the instructions provided here result in a bracelet as the finished project but you can use this design at any length for a choker a cami or tank top strap an anklet or anything you can think of more ideas are presented in the additional notes at the end of this pattern the basic construct is to crochet a separate strand of beads together with your working yarn using a series of slip stitches and chain stitches the slip stitches will hold the beads in place and in the right order while the chain stitches provide the shaping foundation for the design on the next row the following is what i ve used feel free to experiment with different yarn weights hook sizes bead sizes and styles there is ample opportunity to experiment and modify according to your liking ❖ hook size 3 5 mm and/or 3 mm depending on yarn weight 1 variances and personal preference see a comparison photo in the first bullet in the notes below ❖ approximately 6 5 yards loops and threads woolike simili-laine yarn weight 1 i used 3 5 mm hook knitpicks comfy fingering yarn weight 1 i used 3 5 mm hook hobby lobby yarn bee authentic hand-dyed tonal yarn weight 1 use 3mm or 3 5 mm hook ❖ beads beads that are 4 mm work best with this design and yarn weight i ve also used size 8/0 seed beads as accent beads i discuss adjustments for slightly larger beads in the additional notes ❖ 4mm beads ⅜ buttons with a shank on the back and jewelry findings from hobby lobby and a local bead store ➢ hobby lobby metal gallery beads 4x4 mm ➢ hobby lobby czech glass seed beads size 8/0 ➢ hobby lobby on-a-cord and metal gallery connectors buttons closures and jewelry findings at the time of this writing i could not find more of the exact metal beads at hobby lobby that i used here in the pink and multicolored bracelets but i did find the same style on amazon and there are
